p: Plant samples used in this study were collected from wild populations in Europe and North America, thereby covering the current distribution range of the species on these continents (Figure 1). All samples were obtained from apical leaves (second leaf or third leaf from the top) and stored separately in bags with silica gel. About 0.5 square centimeters of dry leaf tissue was ground in a mortar with liquid nitrogen, and DNA was extracted with the E.Z.N.A. ® SP Plant DNA Kit (Omega Bio‐Tek, USA) according to the manufacturer's instructions for dried specimens.
